snippet: An angry President Obama and Congress demanded action after a Pentagon survey estimated 26,000 people in the armed forces were assaulted last year, up from 19,000 in 2010.
abstract: Pres Obama and Congress demand action after Pentagon survey finds that 26,000 people in the armed forces were sexually assaulted in 2012, up from 19,000 in 2010; study comes as the Pentagon prepares to integrate women formally into what had been all-male domains of combat, making the effective monitoring, policing and prosecuting of sexual misconduct all the more pressing.
lead_paragraph: An angry President Obama and Congress demanded action after a Pentagon survey estimated 26,000 people in the armed forces were assaulted last year, up from 19,000 in 2010.

headline.seo: Pentagon Study Sees Sharp Rise in Sexual Assaults
headline.main: Sexual Assaults in Military Raise Alarm in Washington
headline.print_headline: Sexual Assaults in Military Raise Alarm in Capital

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
